key_points: Democrats in Kenosha introduce a bill to update Wisconsin's gun laws for minors.
The proposed legislation would restrict minors from possessing long guns or rifles unless legally hunting.
The bill aims to close a loophole that allowed Kyle Rittenhouse to carry a semiautomatic rifle during the Kenosha unrest.
Kyle Rittenhouse was found not guilty on all charges, with the underage gun possession charge dropped by the judge.
State Sen. Chris Larson argues the bill is necessary to prevent minors from carrying guns in public spaces.
Republican lawmakers oppose the bill, fearing it infringes on second amendment rights.
State Sen. Patrick Testin expresses concern over the bill's impact on school rifle clubs.
Democrats also introduce a package of bills for safer gun storage and reporting of lost or stolen guns.
The 'Safe Storage for Gun Safety' plan aims to prevent gun violence and accidental shootings.
Republican leaders are unlikely to support the new measures due to opposition to past gun control proposals.
